Avoid Too Great a Variety of Mental Food.--God would have the mental faculties kept pure and clean. 


                                                     195 

But often too great a variety of food is given to the mind. It is impossible for this to be properly taken care of and used. The brain should be relieved of all unnecessary burden. Only the studies which will be of the most use not only here but in the future life, which will provide the best instruction for body and soul, will be carried over into eternity.--MS 15, 1898.
